item.title: Balatro‚Äôs Biggest Update Yet Is Taking Longer Than Expected
item.content:encoded:
The boundary between hobbyist and professional is a tricky one‚Äìespecially in creative fields. In balancing the demands of work and creative joy, LocalThunk, lone developer of 2024‚Äôs smash hit roguelike poker game Balatro, has announced that the anticipated 1.1 update won‚Äôt arrive this year.

‚ÄúI am working slowly,‚Äù LocalThunk said in a blog post apologizing for the delayed update, ‚Äúbut I like it that way.‚Äù The solo dev shared that, upon reflection, he ‚Äúprobably shouldn‚Äôt have announced any date for the 1.1 update at all,‚Äù stating that he ‚Äútook a break from everything to do with the game for a few months until the start of 2025.‚Äù In the post, LocalThunk does as much as possible to assure folks that he ‚Äòs committed to producing more Balatro in the future, but hitting a 2025 deadline for the update interfered with what he thinks is ‚Äúthe best version of ‚Äòwork,‚Äô‚Äù which is an approach that avoids burnout and ‚Äúmakes me want to come back to my keyboard every day, healthy, and hopefully just as excited about game development five years from now as I am today.‚Äù He added, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want 1.1 to be the last update this game gets.‚Äù

LocalThunk did not share a timeline for when to expect the update, simply stating, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs done when it‚Äôs done.‚Äù

That sounds ominous, but don‚Äôt fret. In the same post, LocalThunk shares that not only is he still ‚Äúdrawing my silly jokers‚Äù in a ‚Äúnotebook that is now teeming with ideas to implement or test in the game,‚Äù but that after finally unlocking all achievements in the game, ‚Äúthe Balatro player in me will absolutely not allow me to walk away from developing this game.‚Äù

Rather than complaining about the delay, some fans of Balatro have shared positive sentiments regarding the wait. ‚ÄúTake your time. Balatro is great üíú‚Äù reads one reply on X. ‚ÄúThe only reason people are as excited as they are for 1.1 is because you had the chance to take your time when working on Balatro,‚Äù reads another.

Balatro was a hit last year, so it‚Äôs no surprise that folks are hungry for more. Still, it‚Äôs nice to see folks extending some grace, encouraging a dev to take their time to appropriately channel their creative energies into something meaningful and not rushed.



https://kotaku.com/balatro-localthunk-1-1-update-delay-2025-game-development-2000625702

item.title: Pok√©mon‚Äôs Most Infamous Card Sells For $4,000,000
item.content:encoded:
Often considered to be the rarest Pok√©mon card of all, the so-called Pikachu Illustrator (it‚Äôs proper name is ‚ÄúPok√©mon Illustrator‚Äù but no one calls it that) was a print of around 41 cards given to winners of a Japanese competition in 1998. It has since gone on to become notorious, not just for being so highly valued and sought after, but for being the card on which one Logan Paul spent $5,300,000 in 2022. Another of the cards, this one graded as a PSA 9, has just sold for a flat $4,000,000 on eBay, reaffirming it as the most valuable Pok√©mon card of all.

In 1998, when the Pok√©mon TCG was in its infancy, the prize of a unique Pikachu card for the CoroCoro Comic Illustration Contest must have been nice enough, but not all that special. It‚Äôs not known exactly how many were handed out, but it‚Äôs believed 41 were printed, made unique by having the word ‚ÄúILLUSTRATOR‚Äù where ‚ÄúTRAINER‚Äù would usually appear. The holographic image shows Pikachu clutching an enormous paintbrush, while the Japanese text underneath congratulates the recipients as having been ‚Äúrecognized as excellent in the Pok√©mon Card Game Illustration Contest.‚Äù It‚Äôs not known how many survive, but of those that do, the condition they‚Äôre in becomes everything. The card Logan Paul bought for $5,275,000 was graded as a PSA 10, meaning it is in absolutely perfect condition. Meanwhile, a PSA 7 version in 2023 put up for bids starting at $480,000 received not a single offer and went unsold.

On Friday September 12, however, another colossal sale price got added to the roster. (Thanks, Dexerto.) A PSA 9 version of the Pikachu Illustrator went up for auction on eBay from seller Scott ‚Äúsmpratte‚Äù Pratte, and sold for a cool $4,000,000. This specific card, described as ‚Äúthe Holy Grail of Pok√©mon,‚Äù was for a long time thought to be the only PSA 9 to exist, submitted by Pratte himself after he added it to his collection in 2011. According to PSA, in 2017 there were four examples graded 9, and at some point Pratte had owned all four of them. In 2013 he sold another PSA 9 version of the Pikachu, listing it for $100,000, but eventually accepting an offer for $50,000. That‚Äôs 1.25 percent of what he got for another Pikachu Illustrator with the game grading this weekend. He sold another in 2016 for just $55,000, which at the time was considered to be extraordinarily high.

Pok√©mon card prices started to grow in 2020, as the covid lockdowns seemed to drive people to their lofts to find old binders, with classic cards becoming incredibly desirable. This peaked in 2022 when Logan Paul bought the PSA 10 Illustrator as a stunt, and then wore it around his neck on a chain during one of his fake-ass boxing fights. That remains the most expensive card ever, but this weekend‚Äôs sale suggests the impact of that price is lasting. Not least considering a PSA 9 Pikachu Illustrator sold the same year for $840,000.

It‚Äôs not clear why Pratte has chosen to part with it now, although I can think of four million really good reasons. It‚Äôs really hard to imagine this value sustaining, so there‚Äôs a decent chance it‚Äôs been sold at its peak. It‚Äôs notable that someone else sold an identical card just last month for only $625,000, the only difference being that Pratte‚Äôs was the first to be graded at 9. You‚Äôd imagine whoever sold it must be furious right now, but I can‚Äôt help but notice the listing uses the same ‚ÄúHoly Grail!‚Äù language as Pratte‚Äôs eBay listing. Look, eventually someone‚Äôs going to notice that it‚Äôs a piece of cardboard. Also, PSA now lists 15 of the card graded PSA 9, 12 as PSA 8, and 7 as PSA 7.

From searching around on auction sites, I‚Äôve cobbled together a list of claimed dates and prices the Pikachu Illustrator has fetched over the years:

  • Early 2000s: $23,000
  • May 8, 2014: $90,000 (PSA 9)
  • Nov 17, 2016: $54,970 (PSA 9)
  • Apr 2, 2022: $5,275,000 (PSA 10)
  • Jun 11, 2022: $840,000 (PSA 9)
  • Sep 23, 2023: $495,000 (CCG 10)
  • Dec 16, 2023: $137,00 (PSA Altered)
  • Aug 8, 2025: $625,000 (PSA 9)
  • Sep 12, 2025: $4,000,000 (PSA 9)

If you‚Äôre looking to pick up something not quite as rare, but still pretty special, Pratte is still selling a PSA 10 Illusion‚Äôs Zorua prize card for a mere $20,000.



https://kotaku.com/pokemon-pikachu-illustrator-psa9-auction-2000625686

item.title: Amazon‚Äôs Newest Fire TV Cube Just Matched Its Black Friday Price, Likely a Stock Clear-Out
item.content:encoded:
You can make streaming all your favorite movies and shows a seamless experience with the help of a Fire TV. Specifically, the Fire TV Cube which is the most feature-packed streaming device in Amazon‚Äôs lineup. Right now, Amazon, has it marked down by a solid 29%. Normally, you‚Äôd find the Fire TV Cube going for $140, but after the discount, it comes down to just $100. That‚Äôll save you a whole $40 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

The Ultimate Streaming Experience

Okay, I know what your thinking. Why the cube? What‚Äôs better about the cube than the stick? Well, the Fire TV Cube has a built-in mic and speaker. It‚Äôs sort of a Fire TV Stick and an Echo Dot all in one. With the Fire TV Cube, you can use Alexa hands-free. The Fire TV Stick‚Äôs Alexa support is baked into the remote. You need to hold down a button and speak in for it to register what you‚Äôre asking. But what if you‚Äôre all cozied up under a blanket and the remote is all the way over there? Now you see the value.

The Fire TV Cube also uses an octa-core processor which can provide about twice the power of the Fire TV Stick 4K Max‚Äîthe premium option for Fire TV Sticks. It leads to better performance from your apps like speedier start-up times and faster streaming. And with Wi-Fi 6E support, the upper limit of streaming speeds is pretty dang good.

With any Fire TV, you get to download a wide range of streaming apps so you can keep up with all your favorite content. Get Netflix, Disney+, HBO Max (I think that‚Äôs what it‚Äôs called again last I checked), and Prime Video, of course. Enjoy watching your movies and shows with impressive picture and sound quality thanks to support for cinematic 4K, Dolby Vision, HDR, and Dolby Atmos audio.

You can connect all your entertainment sources through your Fire TV Cube, allowing you to switch between them. Just use Alexa to ask to pull up your Xbox when you‚Äôre ready to try again against Sister Splinter in Hollow Knight: Silksong. Then when you give up after 20 more tries, you can ask to switch back over to your cable box in time to catch a rerun of the latest episode of Bob‚Äôs Burgers.

Drop the Stick and go for the Cube. Right now, you can save a good $40 on Amazon‚Äôs Fire TV Cube. You‚Äôll only be paying an even $100 for a limited time.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/amazons-newest-fire-tv-cube-just-matched-its-black-friday-price-likely-a-stock-clear-out-2000625533
